long_description: Taku transforms Yabukita's dependable character into something more aromatic and complex, where the cultivar's natural balance of slight tartness and reliable umami develops into strong yet refreshing bitterness with distinctive fragrance. The enhanced processing draws out deeper vegetal richness from the Yabukita leaves, creating sophisticated layers where the refreshing bitterness carries enhanced aromatic qualities that elevate the typical grassy notes into more nuanced expression. Shiga's traditional methods and terroir influence develop the cultivar's inherent harmony into more structured astringency and characteristic matcha aroma without losing the clean, reliable finish Yabukita is known for. The result reveals how expert handling can elevate even the most familiar cultivar, transforming straightforward Yabukita into a more refined and aromatic experience while preserving its essential balance and honest character.
name: Taku
description: Strong, well-developed character with refreshing bitterness and enhanced aromatic complexity. Yabukita's natural balance elevated by traditional Shiga processing expertise.

cultivars.description: Japan's most widespread cultivar, accounting for ~75% of production. Known for its balanced, reliable flavor profile with grassy notes and versatile character.
cultivars.name: Yabukita

long_description: Isuzu represents the purifying essence of premium matcha craftsmanship, blessed with its name by the chief priest of Ise Shrine after the sacred Isuzu River that flows through Japan's most revered spiritual site. This sophisticated matcha delivers more pronounced character than Aoarashi, featuring sharp and acidic undertones rich in amino acids that create a distinctive cleansing sensation. The bright, creamy texture carries notes of fresh grass, citrus, and sweet spring greens, while its notable astringency provides a subtle citrusy twang that produces a lovely purifying feeling in the mouth. When prepared with lower temperature water (70°C), the flavor softens significantly, revealing mellow umami beneath its vibrant vegetal intensity, making it perfect for those seeking a more dynamic and spiritually resonant matcha experience.
name: Marukyu Koyamaen Isuzu
description: Bolder and more pronounced than Aoarashi, with sharp, amino acid-rich character and cleansing astringency. Named after the sacred Isuzu River near Ise Shrine, symbolizing purification and refreshment.

cultivars.description: Ultimate purity and sophistication from Uji. Zero astringency with rich creamy body, flavors of cashew butter, and silky smooth finish.
cultivars.name: Ujihikari

long_description: Firu represents premium quality from Uji, the legendary birthplace of matcha in Kyoto Prefecture, honoring eight centuries of tea tradition through a carefully crafted multi-cultivar blend that showcases how masterful blending elevates complementary cultivars into transcendent complexity. This shincha harvest captures both Yabukita's reliable foundation and Okumidori's signature umami intensity at their peak amino acid concentration, creating Uji's characteristic harmonious balance of umami sweetness, refined vegetal notes, and gentle bitterness that unfolds in sophisticated layers. The experience opens with bright grassy freshness from Yabukita's clean character enhanced by Uji's prestigious terroir, develops into rich umami depth where Okumidori's nutty complexity and intense amino acid content create profound satisfaction, and finishes with delicate floral undertones and lingering sweetness that exemplifies why Uji matcha has defined excellence for eight centuries. The result embodies the pinnacle of blended matcha craftsmanship, where tradition, terroir, and timing converge to create layers of complexity that honor both cultivars while transcending their individual characteristics.
name: Firu
description: Harmonious blend combining Yabukita's balance with Okumidori's rich umami depth. Elegant sweetness, refined vegetal brightness, and complex layers finishing with delicate floral notes.

cultivars.description: Japan's most widespread cultivar, accounting for ~75% of production. Known for its balanced, reliable flavor profile with grassy notes and versatile character.
cultivars.name: Yabukita

cultivars.description: Premium cultivar with rich umami and sophisticated flavor depth. Features mellow aroma with rose and chocolate hints, distinctive quality.
cultivars.name: Okumidori

long_description: This exceptional hōjicha powder is crafted from premium tencha leaves and stems sourced from the legendary tea fields of Uji-Shirakawa, Kyoto, where mist-covered mountains have nurtured Japan's finest teas for over 800 years. Through careful slow-roasting at relatively low temperatures, the delicate flavors and natural sweetness of the tea are preserved while developing rich, complex aromatics. The result is a refined roasted character with creamy, velvety mouthfeel and gentle toasted notes that deliver warmth without harsh edges. Perfect for creating sophisticated lattes where authentic Japanese quality makes the difference.
name: Moku
description: Slow roasted tencha stems and leaves providing sophisticated roasted flavor with exceptional depth, natural sweetness, and elegant complexity

categories.description: Roasted green tea with a unique flavor
categories.name: Hōjicha

cultivars.description: Shade-grown tea leaves processed for roasted tea powder. Delivers roasted, sweet, mellow flavors with distinctive nutty notes.
cultivars.name: Tencha

long_description: Aoarashi embodies the essence of accessible luxury from Marukyu Koyamaen, Japan's most award-winning matcha producer with over 300 years of expertise in Uji, Kyoto. Named after the strong early summer wind that flows through verdant greenery, this entry-level matcha offers a calm yet robust flavor with notable balance of slight bitterness and astringency, completely free of off-notes. Its well-rounded taste combines excellent quality with approachability, featuring light, smooth character with sweet flavors reminiscent of fresh baby spinach and cucumber, finished with a creamy texture that makes it ideal for traditional preparation, lattes, and culinary applications while maintaining the prestigious Marukyu Koyamaen standard.
name: Marukyu Koyamaen Aoarashi
description: Entry-level excellence from Japan's most prestigious matcha house. Calm, refreshing character with balanced bitterness and astringency, perfect for daily practice and accessible luxury.

cultivars.description: Harmoniously blended cultivars creating balanced flavor, aroma, and color. Rich but mellow, smooth but layered - perfect for everyday drinking.
cultivars.name: Multi-Cultivar Blend

long_description: Seiun, meaning 'blue cloud', captures the serenity and splendor of a clear morning sky in Uji, Kyoto, where this matcha is meticulously grown and harvested from first flush tender spring leaves. This premium blend places firmly in Ippodo's rich category, offering hearty umami and sweet taste with a lingering finish and full character that feels smooth and velvety on the tongue. Named by the head of the Urasenke school, Seiun delivers deep umami, balanced sweetness, and just a whisper of refined bitterness, making it ideal for matcha enthusiasts seeking a reflective, satisfying teatime experience. It has a rich, inviting aroma that whisks into vibrant jade froth, finishing clean with a lingering, almost creamy aftertaste that speaks to its exceptional quality.
name: Ippodo Seiun
description: Deep umami, balanced sweetness with whisper of refined bitterness, rich and full-bodied with long elegant finish

cultivars.description: Harmoniously blended cultivars creating balanced flavor, aroma, and color. Rich but mellow, smooth but layered - perfect for everyday drinking.
cultivars.name: Multi-Cultivar Blend

long_description: Grown in the legendary red clay soils of Shirakawa, Uji under traditional honzu shading at 95% darkness, this blend harmonizes three distinct cultivars to create remarkable complexity and balance. The classic Samidori cultivar contributes bright emerald color and deep umami foundation, while the rare Gokou adds its signature fruity aromatics and creamy oceanic notes, perfectly grounded by Yabukita's well-balanced earthiness and rich mineral character. Each hand-selected leaf undergoes the farmer's innovative once-annual harvest method with double-rate organic fertilization, resulting in some of Japan's highest recorded L-theanine levels and an extraordinarily refined drinking experience that bridges traditional ceremony and modern versatility.
name: Hikū
description: Harmonious balance of velvety sweetness, fruity aromatics, and oceanic umami with exceptional smoothness and minimal astringency.

cultivars.description: Japan's most widespread cultivar, accounting for ~75% of production. Known for its balanced, reliable flavor profile with grassy notes and versatile character.
cultivars.name: Yabukita

cultivars.description: Renowned premium Uji cultivar with deep umami flavor and noble heritage. Full-bodied, mellow, rich and creamy with distinctive nutty notes.
cultivars.name: Samidori

cultivars.description: One of Japan's deepest and most robust cultivars with adventurous character. Features roasted chocolate, oceanic minerality, and bold complexity.
cultivars.name: Gokou

long_description: Zeno presents the unadulterated expression of Okumidori's remarkable character, where Tsuchiyama's traditional terroir allows this prestigious cultivar to showcase its full intensity without the softening influence of blending, creating a matcha of exceptional depth and aromatic complexity. The shincha harvest timing captures Okumidori at its amino acid peak, developing the cultivar's signature sweet, nutty fragrance reminiscent of toasted walnuts and buttery pastries, while Shiga's historic processing methods enhance the naturally robust umami that makes this cultivar so prized for premium applications. As a single cultivar expression, Zeno delivers Okumidori's characteristically strong taste with pronounced flavor intensity, where the rich, complex umami unfolds in waves of walnut-tinged satisfaction, balanced by the cultivar's natural sweetness and enhanced by subtle floral finishing notes. The result showcases both the bold personality that single cultivar matcha can achieve and the sophisticated complexity that emerges when farmer's 140 years of expertise meets one of Japan's most distinctive and umami-rich cultivars in its purest form.
name: Zeno
description: Pure Okumidori intensity with sweet nutty aroma and complex, robust character. Rich umami depth balanced by pronounced flavor strength and distinctive walnut-tinged complexity.

cultivars.description: Premium cultivar with rich umami and sophisticated flavor depth. Features mellow aroma with rose and chocolate hints, distinctive quality.
cultivars.name: Okumidori

long_description: Sayaka represents Ippodo's masterful blending artistry from the legendary tea fields of Uji, Kyoto, where centuries of expertise have perfected the balance between accessibility and sophistication. Crafted from first-harvest tender buds, this 'light-hearted, smooth tea in the rich category' delivers refined taste with just the right amount of richness, featuring complex flavors such as the slight bitterness of spring vegetables. Sayaka offers smooth sweetness and umami accompanied by a hint of bitterness. The bright green liquor and soft astringency create an approachable yet sophisticated experience perfect for traditional preparation or modern latte applications.
name: Ippodo Sayaka
description: Smooth sweetness and umami with hint of bitterness, refined taste with notes of spring vegetables.

cultivars.description: Harmoniously blended cultivars creating balanced flavor, aroma, and color. Rich but mellow, smooth but layered - perfect for everyday drinking.
cultivars.name: Multi-Cultivar Blend

long_description: Each leaf is meticulously handpicked from Shirakawa's historic tea fields, where farmer's radical approach using unpruned trees and proprietary organic fertilization has achieved the highest L-theanine concentrations in Japan. The 50% Samidori cultivar, bred specifically for shaded tea production in 1939, provides the blend's characteristic bright jade color and exceptional umami depth, while the 50% Yabukita foundation offers robust earthiness and mineral complexity. This matcha has developed remarkable complexity through careful aging, revealing layers of creamy sweetness, marine umami, and subtle confectionery notes.
name: Kiyō
description: Ultra-refined ceremonial balance of legendary sweetness and robust earthiness with intense umami and creamy, smooth texture.

cultivars.description: Japan's most widespread cultivar, accounting for ~75% of production. Known for its balanced, reliable flavor profile with grassy notes and versatile character.
cultivars.name: Yabukita

cultivars.description: Renowned premium Uji cultivar with deep umami flavor and noble heritage. Full-bodied, mellow, rich and creamy with distinctive nutty notes.
cultivars.name: Samidori

long_description: Yura delivers the bold, concentrated intensity that late-season Yabukita harvesting creates, where extended growing time develops pronounced bitterness with remarkable clarity and clean definition. The summer and autumn picking allows the cultivar's natural catechins to fully mature, producing crisp astringency that balances bright, grassy vegetal notes without harsh edges or unpleasant aftertastes. Tsuchiyama's flat terrain and Lake Biwa's influence create a refreshing quality that enhances Yabukita's signature reliable character, turning the cultivar's slight tartness into invigorating bitterness with clean finish. The result showcases how terroir and timing can intensify Yabukita's natural balance into a robustly satisfying matcha with concentrated vegetal richness and crisp, energizing bite.
name: Yura
description: Bold, refreshing character with pronounced bitterness and crisp astringency. Clean vegetal notes with Yabukita's reliable foundation and concentrated late-season intensity.

cultivars.description: Japan's most widespread cultivar, accounting for ~75% of production. Known for its balanced, reliable flavor profile with grassy notes and versatile character.
cultivars.name: Yabukita

long_description: Giru showcases the refined balance that has made Nishio Japan's largest matcha-producing region, where optimal weather conditions, ideal elevation, and fertile soil create the perfect environment for developing abundant umami sweetness with remarkably gentle bitterness. This shincha harvest blend captures the concentrated amino acids of first harvest timing, allowing the carefully selected cultivars to express their natural sweetness while Nishio's singular focus on matcha cultivation—with over 95% of fields dedicated to tencha—ensures exceptional color vibrancy and mellow aromatic complexity. The region's temperate climate and rich soil develop a smooth, rounded character that delivers substantial matcha flavor without harsh astringency, creating layers that open with vibrant green intensity and mellow fragrance, build into satisfying umami depth, and finish with only slight bitterness that enhances rather than overwhelms the natural sweetness. The result exemplifies Nishio's mastery in producing approachable yet sophisticated matcha, where expert blending and ideal terroir create harmonious balance perfect for both traditional preparation and modern applications.
name: Giru
description: Mellow, well-rounded character with abundant umami sweetness and gentle bitterness. Rich matcha flavor with vibrant color and refined aroma from Nishio's optimal terroir.

cultivars.description: Early harvest cultivar with rich umami taste, mild sweetness, and vibrant clear green appearance. Known for its well-rounded flavor profile and smooth texture.
cultivars.name: Saemidori

cultivars.description: Premium cultivar with rich umami and sophisticated flavor depth. Features mellow aroma with rose and chocolate hints, distinctive quality.
cultivars.name: Okumidori
